journal-meta.journal-title: Proceedings of the Institution of Mechanical Engineers, Part I: Journal of Systems and Control Engineering

title-group.article-title: Fuzzy control with robust and passive properties for discrete-time Takagi–Sugeno fuzzy systems with multiplicative noises

article-meta.aff: 1Department of Marine Engineering, National Taiwan Ocean University, Keelung Taiwan, Republic of China
2Department of Electrical Engineering, National Taiwan Ocean University, Keelung, Taiwan, Republic of China

author-notes.corresp: *Department of Marine Engineering National Taiwan Ocean University, Keelung 202, Taiwan, Republic of China. email: wjchang@mail.ntou.edu.tw

abstract.p: This paper deals with the problem of robust fuzzy control for uncertain passive discrete-time non-linear stochastic systems with multiplicative noise. In this paper the non-linear stochastic system is represented by a Takagi–Sugeno fuzzy model. Using that approach the concept of parallel distributed compensation is applied to construct the fuzzy controller. Sufficient stability conditions are derived in terms of a linear matrix inequality by applying the Lyapunov theory. In addition, the passivity theory and robust technique are used to guarantee strict input passivity and robust asymptotical stability of the closed-loop system with admissible parameter uncertainties. Finally, a numerical example concerning the control of a truck–trailer system is provided to demonstrate the validity of the proposed fuzzy controller design method.

sec.title: 1 Introduction
sec.p: Under certain circumstances, it is possible for real systems to suffer from random noise effects. This makes the system a stochastic system that can be analysed using stochastic models containing multiplicative noises [1,2]. Furthermore, parameter uncertainty [3] often occurs due to inaccuracies in the model and/or changes in the environment. The existence of parameter uncertainties makes the control problem of stochastic systems more difficult and challenging than the same problem for deterministic systems. This paper is focused on the solution of a fuzzy control problem for an uncertain stochastic system displaying multiplicative noise.

It is common knowledge that it is difficult to analyse and design control techniques for complex non-linear systems. Recently, fuzzy logic has been applied to approximate the non-linearities inherent in such systems. In particular, a model-based fuzzy approximation method called the Takagi–Sugeno (T–S) fuzzy model [4] has become a popular approach to stability analysis and controller design in non-linear systems. In fact many practical non-linear systems have been successfully represented using the T–S fuzzy model [4] combined with the parallel distributed compensation (PDC) concept [5]. This approach, which allows linear control criteria to be applied to analyse complex non-linear systems, is adopted in this paper.

Passivity theory [6–11] provides a useful tool to discuss the effect of disturbances on a system and it has been applied in the design of a fuzzy controller using a T–S fuzzy model with external disturbance [12–15]. Using the Lyapunov function, the stability conditions can be derived in the form of a linear matrix inequality (LMI). Through well mathematical definitions [16], the passive theory can be converted to various kinds of control performance including
H
∞
control and
L
2
control.

The focus of this paper is the design of a passive fuzzy controller for uncertain discrete-time stochastic T–S fuzzy systems with multiplicative noises. In previous work, the current authors addressed the problem of passive fuzzy controller design for T–S fuzzy systems with multiplicative noises in discrete-time [13] and continuous-time [15] cases, respectively. However, the system considered in [13] and [15] did not consider the issue of perturbations on the system parameters. Perturbations were considered in a continuous-time stochastic T–S fuzzy model in [14]. Extending the results presented in [13–15], passive fuzzy control for perturbed discrete-time stochastic T–S fuzzy systems with multiplicative noises is investigated in this paper. One can find that the stability condition developed in [13] is a special case of the results developed in this paper if one neglects the perturbation effects in this paper. Also, the derivations of the approach in [14] are more complicated than those in this paper. This is because the perturbation constraints considered in the lemmas of [14] are more conservative than those considered in this paper. Thus, this paper provides a useful methodology to design fuzzy controllers that allow a desired passivity performance to be achieved.

The proposed fuzzy controller design methodology is developed by using the PDC concept and the Lyapunov stability criterion. Passivity theory is also used to guarantee the disturbance attenuation performance of the system. Based on the LMI technique [17], one can find a suitable common positive-definite matrix and feedback gains that satisfy the derived stability conditions. Then, a PDC-based passive fuzzy controller can be designed using the obtained feedback gains. According to the proposed stability criterion, the non-linear stochastic system driven by the designed fuzzy controller is strictly input passive and robustly asymptotically stable. Finally, a simulation result is presented to show the effectiveness and application of the proposed design method.

This paper is organized as follows. The uncertain discrete-time stochastic T–S fuzzy system with multiplicative noises is described in section 2. In section 3, the stability conditions are discussed based on passivity theory and Lyapunov theory. The fuzzy controller design procedure based on the PDC and a LMI is also developed in section 3 for the T–S fuzzy system. Simulation results obtained by applying the proposed design approach are provided in section 4. Finally, concluding remarks are made in section 5.

sec.title: 2 System Descriptions and Problem Statements
sec.p: In the fuzzy modelling approach a non-linear stochastic system is represented by a T–S fuzzy model with multiplicative noises [13–15]. External disturbances and uncertainties are considered in this paper to closer represent real environments. The following definitions and lemmas need to be introduced to allow the stability criterion to be derived. Passivity theory provides a useful tool to discuss the effect of external disturbances on a system so that a required attenuation performance can be achieved. Hence, passivity theory is introduced in the following definition.

sec.title: 3 Robust Passive Fuzzy Controller Design
sec.p: In order to design the fuzzy controller for the closed-loop T–S fuzzy model (6), the sufficient stability conditions are developed via passivity theory and Lyapunov theory. Based on these conditions, a fuzzy controller can be designed that guarantees the system to be robustly asymptotically stable and strictly input passive.

It is obvious that the inequality (29) is not a LMI condition. In order to use the convex optimization technique to find solutions for inequality (29), it is necessary to convert equation (29) into the LMI form using transformations. Consider the closed-loop system (6). Using the Matlab LMI-toolbox to solve the stability conditions of Theorem 2, for a dissipative rate
γ = 1
one can obtain that
Subsequently, one can obtain the following feedback gains position of decimal point

According to the PDC concept, the fuzzy controller (5) can be constructed using the feedback gains stated in equation (37). Based on the designed fuzzy controller, the state responses of the considered system are stated in Figs 3 to 5 with initial conditions
x ( 0 ) =
[
1
− 0 . 5
0
]
T
and sampling time 0.2 s. The following equation can be introduced to check the passivity performance of the closed-loop system
Based on Definition 1, strict input passivity of system (35) can be achieved by using the fuzzy controller (5) with feedback gains (37) since the value described in equation (38) is smaller than one.

For comparison purposes the fuzzy controller developed in [23] was used to control system (35) with the same system parameters and uncertainties as in the case studied for the proposed fuzzy controller design. It is clear in Figs 3 to 5 that the proposed fuzzy controller provides better responses than the controller developed in [23]. For the case of increasing system parameter values of multiplicative noise, i.e. the parameters in equation (36), the responses driven by the controller of [23] will diverge. Hence, the advantage of the proposed design method is that one can design a stable fuzzy controller with multiplicative noise based on the system parameters defined in equation (36). That is, the proposed PDC-based fuzzy controller design approach can be used to deal with the stability and passivity control problem for an uncertain discrete-time stochastic T–S fuzzy system with multiplicative noises.

sec.title: 5 Conclusions
sec.p: The uncertain discrete-time stochastic T–S fuzzy system with multiplicative noise was considered in this paper. Using passivity theory and Lyapunov theory, conditions have been derived in terms of a LMI that are sufficient to guarantee strict input passivity and robust asymptotical stability of systems with admissible parameter uncertainties. In order to apply a convex optimal programming algorithm, the stability conditions were converted into the LMI form. A fuzzy controller can be obtained based on the LMI stability conditions using the PDC concept. A numerical example on the control of a non-linear truck–trailer system has been also presented to illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach.

ack.p: The authors would like to express their sincere thanks to the anonymous reviewers for their constructive comments, criticisms, and suggestions that significantly improved this paper. This work was supported by the National Science Council of the Republic of China under contract NSC98-2221-E-019-034.
